column4: hello im having problems getting ubuntu on my ispiron 1300 it keeps saying no bootable devices missing opeating system
first, go into bios and make sure that it's set to boot from hd...
and/or usb or cd
Secondly, how did you put the install files on the thumb drive?
Ok, strange, then, but then do have a look in the bios and make sure that it can boot from usb
it has on the list of boot sequences it has 1 usb storage device 2 cd dvd cdrw drive 3 internal hdd 4 onbouard nic 5 diskette drive
Strange that it doesn't boot from the thumb drive, then. You *are* sure that you used the startup disk creator?
yes i just remforated it and now im about to redo the process
Do report back then. I'm not sure what else can cause it :-(
have any idea why the cd keeps showing up blank after i use the instrutions and it says success on the program i write it with
Not really, I'm afraid. Sounds weird as well...
u think the comp is just &*(*(& up or is there a way to do it?
There is always a way, but it would be hard for me to assist without being there physically :-(
Also, I need to get ready for uni soon...
i have team viewer 6
Wouldn't do much good for bios settings and boot, would it?
well it would let u make the startupdisc with this computer
Well, I wonder why it didn't work in the first place, but the program has a limited set of options, so I don't think that'll make a lot of difference
well thanks for helping :D \
Np and good luck
omg i got it to work i used a diff thumb drive maybe the other one just was bad idk why though i still use it to hold movies and wacth them on my xbox
Good to hear! But perhaps you should look into retiring it ;-)
